goal.en: The objective of this course is to provide an introduction to a few well-known econometric tools that are commonly used in applied research with data in business, economics and finance. Topics covered include ARMA models, vector autoregressions (VAR), unit roots, and volatility GARCH models. A balance will be maintained between the theoretical analysis and real applications.
goal.ch: The objective of this course is to provide an introduction to a few well-known econometric tools that are commonly used in applied research with data in business, economics and finance. Topics covered include ARMA models, vector autoregressions (VAR), unit roots, and volatility GARCH models. A balance will be maintained between the theoretical analysis and real applications.

content.en:
Stationary Time Series Models (ARMA Models)
Non-Stationary Time Series Models
Multivariate Time Series Models (VAR Models)
Cointegration
GVAR Models
Factor Models
Volatility Models (GARCH Models) (optional)
content.ch:
Stationary Time Series Models (ARMA Models)
Non-Stationary Time Series Models / Unit Roots
Multivariate Time Series Models (VAR Models)
Cointegration
GVAR Models
Factor Models
Volatility Models (GARCH Models) (optional)

textbook.en: Walter Enders, Applied Economic Time Series, 4th Edition, Wiley, 2014 Other Material (其他參考書目) Suggested Books: Hamilton, J.D. (1994). Time Series Analysis, Princeton: Princeton University Press. Tsay, R.S. (2010). Analysis of Financial Time Series, 3rd edition, Wiley. Tsay, R.S. (2013). Multivariate Time Series Analysis: With R and Financial Applications, Wiley. Cochrane, J (2005). Time Series for Macroeconomics and Finance. (Available from Cochrane‘s website at University of Chicago)

(Available from Cochrane‘s website at University of Chicago)

grading.en: Problem sets (10％) Midterm Exam (45％) Final Exam (45％)
